page.title: 12Roads and Employment
page.content: {Other means of Transport. The main methods of transport have been mentioned,but one or two people do cycle around the area,yet as it is quite hilly it is not one of the more popular forms.Many people who live in the villages usually walk if they have not got very far to go,yet from village to village is difficult not only because of hills but also because of the hazards caused by narrow roads with high Cornish walls. {Employment. As the area is at the end of the Roseland Peninsula,this means that there are difficulties of employment. The area is some distance from the main A road and the connecting roads from this block are mainly winding and narrow,skirting farms and medows.They are therefore unsuitable fof heavy traffic.{PTO
